website_summaries.verdict: One of the best USB-C hub adapters you'll find when you need plenty of connection options.
pros: Reasonable price considering all of the different types of ports you'll receive
Includes three USB 3.0 ports, an Ethernet port, a USB-C power port, an HDMI port, an SD card reader, and a micro-SD card reader
Hub is a small size, so you can take it with you when traveling
cons: May not charge some devices properly
Occasionally causes networking issues when using Ethernet port

customer_reviews.title: great! Easy to use!! Great price for a dock!!
customer_reviews.text: What a great piece of equipment! Was so easy to setup!!
customer_reviews.author: Ken from Hotlanta

customer_reviews.title: The Vava does work with the MacBook Pro 2018. A real multi-tool.
customer_reviews.text: While the USB C ports work fine, the HDMI will not sync properly. **DO NOT BUY** for the MBP 2018. The only AV adapter that seems to work is the Apple adapter at like $60 - ack ack! **Update** - After checking the HDMI cable and connections to our work monitor, it was not the Vava Hub. Score revisited and revised. Actually, it is not easy to find a working hub with as many possibilities as the Vava has. The USB slots are flawless, the USB C connection is a satisfying "click" and the SD card ports are solid.
customer_reviews.author: Malcolm GrangerTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Lots of connections!
customer_reviews.text: This is a spiffy little device. Turns into a rapid charger when connected to my phone. Purchased for a laptop to add some USB slots. Girlfriend wants to steal it bc it allows her pixel to have wired headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Jaime V Salazar

customer_reviews.title: Works great, albeit gets a wee hot. +125F .
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this continuously for over a month. With both ethernet and wifi (on and off). Unplugging occasionally to walk to a different office area or conference room, returning with no issues regarding network connectivity. I plug the Macbook Pro Touch power (87w) USB-C / thunderbolt3 into this adapter and it delivers power, gigabit ethernet, USB type A compatibility for my USB memory stick and a HDMI display to for an extended monitor. This has been working well for me. Although it does get hot. upto 125F . See image.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it! 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Sleek and slim design. Works perfectly with my Dell XPS 13. The Ethernet and 3 USB 3.0 ports are useful when I'm traveling so I don't need to bring my bulky Dell original dock station with me in case the hotel room doesn't provide wifi. The build quality looks good, haven't had any issues yet, the 18-month warranty sounds good. 5 Stars.
customer_reviews.author: Michael N

customer_reviews.title: A good multi-tool device
customer_reviews.text: This is a multiple tools in 1 device, including USB hubs, HDMI, card readers and ethernet, tested on a MacBook Pro 2017, the ports are working as expected. The integrated ports are pretty useful since the MBP 2017 has only type-C connections. My only complain is it does not have a type-c charging cable come with it, so I cannot test the charging port at this point. I am not sure without external power supply, it can support multiple tools at the same time.
customer_reviews.author: JackZh

customer_reviews.title: EASY USE
customer_reviews.text: it's very easy to use and picture quality is very good
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: The hub has just arrived and I liked how it was well wrapped. It works perfectly right out of the box! No setup or driver was needed. The very first thing I liked about this product is this hub come with a HDMI port and an Ethernet, I can let my dell laptop become a desktop. Additionally, it comes with 3 USB 3.0 ports which are useful to eliminate clutter near my computer. You can connect both USB 2.0 and USB 3.0 devices to the hub and you see no lag time.
customer_reviews.author: Qian Vanrossum

customer_reviews.title: unreliable, hangs local network
customer_reviews.text: Device gets pretty hot when simultaneously used to power laptop, connect ethernet, drive 4k display and access USB connected external drive. Worst of all during use this device periodically hangs all network traffic on the local subnet and, a my connected 4k display periodically blanks.
customer_reviews.author: Antoinette Alan

customer_reviews.title: Temporary Device
customer_reviews.text: Loved it when i first got it and after one week of use it simply stopped working. The same two computer that i have been using all of a sudden stopped recognizing the device after being plugged in. I thought is may have been my computer but i plugged into my second Type-c laptop and sometime get to use the USB-A and not the mini storage card slot or the regular storage card slot. Now i get nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This gets HOT! TF slot not working.
customer_reviews.text: At least it works. The problem I have had with the dongles that fit the two usb C holes is that they don't stay stably connected. This stays connected but gets hot. There's no good choices... :-( The spring-loaded slot for TF card doesn't hold the card.
customer_reviews.author: Catbirdee53

customer_reviews.title: it worked fine for 3 days
customer_reviews.text: The hub looked well made. And, it worked fine for 3 days. But, it stopped working abruptly while it was plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: MD

customer_reviews.title: THIS HUB IS NOT USB 3.0!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: As Daniel Griscom added to his review, I am now being harassed regularly via email by the seller to remove my review, in exchange for $55. I will not remove my review. For those of you considering purchasing from this seller, be warned! This hub is advertised as having two USB 3.0 ports (blue). However, these ports are NOT 3.0, and the entire hub reports as 2.0 under System Details in Mac (see picture). DO NOT PURCHASE IF YOU REQUIRE 3.0 SPEEDS!
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Hub needs power supply to run, but won't charge anything. The power in my tablet is net negative with the hub, so now I need to purchase a separate power supply, and it won't charge anything while the description says it will charge fast. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Yukie Murphy

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after a few days
customer_reviews.text: After a few days the abilty to connect ethernet to my PCs failed. USB still works.
customer_reviews.author: Nigel Bean

customer_reviews.title: works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great. As advertised. This is the NYtimes Wirecutter's #1 USB C Adapter. They usually know what they are talking about. I couldn't agree more. Also, if you have the Apple USB C, try restarting your computer as that may have been why the HDMI wasn't working. This VAVA adapter has 3 USB ports though so that is sweet. Now I don't have to switch back and forth from my mouse and printer :)
customer_reviews.author: persi530

customer_reviews.title: Really good USB-C hub with all of the feature you could possible want (and more)
customer_reviews.text: The hub works really well with my 2017 13.3" MacBook Pro. I constantly have my external monitor and ethernet cable plugged into it and I have not had any issues. It even works well when hooked up to my ethernet and monitor without plugging it power. The hub also worked well when I have plugged devices into the USB ports. I have not tried out the card readers yet. I had a few questions about the product and the seller was very quick to respond. The only issue I have is that the hub does get a bit hot when you plug it in.
customer_reviews.author: Stu Moriens

customer_reviews.title: A small, useful USB-C hub with good connectivity options
customer_reviews.text: This hub is relatively inexpensive and can provide power charging passthrough, gigabit ethernet, HDMI, USB, audio, SD card, and Micro SD card ports. No drivers, completely plug and play, and everything works out of the box. I would've liked an additional USB-C port that's not dedicated to charging pass-through, but it's a very minor concern. It's a stylish form factor, and very slim. To accomodate the slim nature, if you want to use the Ethernet port, the port hinges out slightly for you to fit an RJ45 cable in. Not a big deal considering it means the design can be streamlined, however I'm curious how many times one can unhinge the RJ45 port before something breaks... Time will tell!
customer_reviews.author: David R. Chase

customer_reviews.title: Works great with iPad Pro 11inch
customer_reviews.text: I received this today and so far works GREAT. I have an iPad Pro 11inch. I have hooked the VAVA to my iPad pro and a power supply to the other USB C port on the VAVA. iPad pro charges fine. I simultaneously have hooked up: Headphones to the audio jack (this works) Arturia Keylab 49 Essential MIDI keyboard to the VAVA USB A port (works great). All are working together without any issues. I'll add other comments if issues arise or if new cool features come up.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Daley

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but expensive and draws 160 mA idle.  Buy only if you have exactly one USB-C port.
customer_reviews.text: This adapter works fine, but at $60, it's quite expensive unless you only have a single USB-C port and actually need the charging passthrough. In any other situation, you'd be better off with a simpler USB-C hub for $15 and a separate HDMI adapter for another $15; you'd be spending half as much or less, and getting a better result. The other problem with this adapter is that it draws 160 mA idle (measured on a USB power meter), whereas my simple Aukey USB hub has no measurable idle draw. This hub also has a 3.5mm audio jack, but it was not detected on my Macbook Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Terran

customer_reviews.title: Ethernet wasan't up to par, but company made it right
customer_reviews.text: EDIT: Total "WOW" for customer service. Company offered to completely refund my money and let me keep the hub. Amazing to see a company stand by it's products like that. Original: Works great for USB and power. Ethernet is another story... despite being rated for gigabit, it regularly maxed out at 320Mbps download. My Anker USB-C dongle, by comparison, regularly shows 550Mbps with everything else the exact same (cables, network, etc.).
customer_reviews.author: Tyler B

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after a few months
customer_reviews.text: I am updating this review as the VAVA team reached out to me and offered to send me a new product! You don’t often see these companies on amazon reach out to make the situation right with customers so hats off to VAVA. ——— Used this for HDMI and charging and after about 6 months the product suddenly doesn't work anymore and when it does work it is intermittent and the device gets very hot. Would not recommend as there are much better options for over half the price.
customer_reviews.author: colin gildea

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, compact size when not loaded up with plugs
customer_reviews.text: Very useful adding USB A ports to my laptop, with PD power throughput (meaning I can plug my power cable directly into this hub, and this hub will power my laptop as well as any devices plugged into the hub as well). Doesn't feel the sturdiest but has served me well for over a year now. It does get a little unwieldy when you have everything plugged in, as the cable that connects the hub to your USB C port is short and very inflexible. The USB C plug that connects to my laptop could also fit a but more snugly, but that could also just be wear and tear. Other than that this product has delivered on its promises,
customer_reviews.author: Adrian Cheong

customer_reviews.title: Great Price for a Decent USB C adapter
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a decent USB C adapter, but I ran into the same issue that others have reported: When it's connected to ethernet (wired) and a USB C power supply it will flood the network when not attached to a computer (seems that the built-in NIC goes nuts without the host computer attached). This was causing major issues for my home network and all devices on the same switch failed to connect to the network. There were other odd issues on the parent network switch and required a reboot of everything after disconnecting this device from both USB C power and ethernet. Update: The vendor sent me an updated version that fixed the networking issue. Very happy!
customer_reviews.author: J.E.

customer_reviews.title: Great for laptops that lack USB and Ethernet ports!
customer_reviews.text: Great product as advertised! I purchased a new laptop that had two USB-A ports, but they were on opposing sides and one USB C port. This Hub allowed me to use my keyboard which requires two USB A ports, use my Ethernet cable without compromising speed, and still have room for more. -Slim, compact design - 3 USB As on one side -USB C -Ethernet port -SD Card -HDMI
customer_reviews.author: Yousaf Malik

customer_reviews.title: Cover nearly everything you need in a small form factor
customer_reviews.text: This USB C hub has all of today's common connector types. It is small and light enough for travelling and on the go. Built quality is surprisingly good. My main use is to expand the number of USB ports and charging power banks/cellphone in low amperage/wattage to prolong the battery life. For that purpose, it does a perfect job for me. If you are planning on using it as a PD adapter, there is a warning sticker on the product that is not shown in the product description. See my photo for the warnings regarding temperature and power output. All in all, this is a good USB-C hub with pretty much all the common types of port for today's need.
customer_reviews.author: onlyP

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt hold ethernet and gets super hot
customer_reviews.text: I would not reccomend this product. This product didnt even last half a year. I bought it so that I can use ethernet through my laptop, which doesnt have an ethernet port. This doesnt work anymore unless I physically press the cord to the dongle. Also, it gets really hot. Like, burn the palm of your hand hot. And it does so if you leave it connected for long periods of time. I first noticed this when I left it on my desk overnight, plugged into my laptop which was in sleep mode.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel B

customer_reviews.title: UPDATED: If you sit really still, it works
customer_reviews.text: I'm updating my review to note a few things: The second adaptor eventually stabilized. I have the occasional issue with drivers, a simple unplug and re-plug fixes it. I've also updated my review on the basis of a great customer service experience. When I attempted to return the first adapter I promptly received a replacement. After leaving my review the seller reached out to me to make sure I was happy with the product. ORIGINAL SITUATION The first adapter I received was virtually unusable: If it is so much as lightly jostled, tapped, or heaven-forbid moved, the HDMI output is disrupted. Power-delivery still works, but you might say goodbye to your external monitor setup. It shouldn't be so spotty
customer_reviews.author: E. Osakue

customer_reviews.title: Good quality if you need multiple USBs, HDMI and 3.5. But no 60watt pass-through
customer_reviews.text: Good quality. I needed a hub w a 3.5 jack for some speakers, an HDMI, and a few USBs, so this worked. I have a key-board, mouse and 40" monitor plugged into it and it doesn't get very hot. One thing is, it doesn't pass through enough power to my Dell laptop. The laptop needs a minimum of 60watts and apparently this doesn't reach that level. But it's ok. I didn't think about using it to also power (pass-through) my laptop until after. That will be my next goal, finding a good power pass-through hub. I'm not a techie, so it may take me some time to educate myself. 🤷
customer_reviews.author: JimH

customer_reviews.title: FRIED One of my USB-C Ports - DO NOT USE!!!
customer_reviews.text: This little gem came recommended by a friend who owns a computer repair business. Unfortunately now I am in need of a repair due to this device permanently killing one of my USB-C ports. I got an error message from my macbook stating that the USB device was drawing too much power, but the only thing I was using with the VAVA was a (wired) mouse, so I'd switch to the trackpad for a while and then continue to use it. Well, now one of the four ports on my macbook will not work at all, even after I reset the SMC. DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT!!!!
customer_reviews.author: AndiSchu

customer_reviews.title: Works on Capable Android Devices
customer_reviews.text: I've only had this item for a couple of days. But, sofar, so good. I am using this on my sams cing galaxy tab 6. I tested all of the ports except the ethernet port. I give it 4 stars because it requires power to access all of the ports. I did not know this when I bought it. Maybe that isjust for the tablet, but not For the computer. But, it has a port for it which is also USB-C. They should have included a cable for the power. On the brightside, it does charge my tablet when plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: tyrihay

customer_reviews.title: I bought it for my Asus Zenbook 3 and it doesn't charge it
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for my Asus Zenbook 3 and it doesn't charge it with the original charger. I wrote to the seller and this is his answer. "Firstly, this hub supports pass-through charging of up to 100W. However, when connected to a standard 60W power adapter, the hub and the peripheral devices will use about 10 - 15W of power, thus the final charge supplied will be 49W-45W which may not be enough for some laptops. If charging is not started, please change to an adapter with higher output" Which for me means buy a hub and than buy a charger. When you buy they say it is good for Asus laptops. False advertisement
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Pratt

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly with USB C PD adapter XPS 13
customer_reviews.text: Used this with my XPS 13 9360 to connect my external monitor, keyboard and my USB C PD 45W power adapter to charge my computer at the same time. Pretty much replaces the need for me to get an expensive usb c hub (unless you have more than one monitor). Prices are a bit high still but I didn't see many other PD options at this range. All in all works like advertised and the constructions seems solid and matches the color of my XPS 13 with the gunmetal gray which is nice.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: This was my 3rd USB-C Hub purchase. the first 2 were purchased from a different vendor and it constantly got over-heated and would stop working properly. This one is working amazingly. It does not get hot like the other products. It's a little warm, but nothing that concerns me. Each of the input items works perfectly. The product seems to be of great quality and feels amazing. It's just the right size to fit in my pocket if necessary. I highly recommended this product!
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product. I can't believe it actually works but ...
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. I can't believe it actually works but it charges my MacBook Pro 15 inch (2017) using USB-C and connects to my LG 27 IPS display through HDMI at the same time. It takes up a surprisingly small amount of desk space. Could not be happier.
customer_reviews.author: Elliot

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to the hype
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product mainly because of the very positive review it received on WireCutter. Happily, the product lives up to that review. I have been using the hub to interface between my old Macbook Pro, new Macbook Air, and WD external hard drive. In addition, I will be using this product during future syncs between my new Macbook Air, iPhone, and iPad. No drivers or installation of any software was required and I have had no problems thus far. The product is easy to use, and I appreciate the blue light that goes on to signify when the product is operational. So far, a very good purchase for the price. No complaints at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Lee

customer_reviews.title: Travel size.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for IOS use, not laptop. This review is only for tablet device. This brand sells many options. Pick the best for you. Ideal for projects requiring use of USB 2.0 USB 3.0 mic input HDMI. Feels quality. Lifetime cs and 18 month warranty! Usb c cable not detachable. Store it with your device. Excellent usb c connection. User guide nice: small print and extra paper. Tips for use important. I did not look for the cheapest for daily use HUB.
customer_reviews.author: Bond Street llc

customer_reviews.title: Great little gadget
customer_reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised by the size. Its the perfect traveling size! I have multiple USB charging devices that I can plug in while traveling. However, I did purchase separately an Anker Quick Charge 3.0 43.5W adapter to charge my laptop as well. I used Samsung Dex successfully with an S10e too. Currently its plugged into my laptop with 4TB external storage and a TV tuner. A little bit on the pricey side but you always have to pay for quality.
customer_reviews.author: TexasDude

customer_reviews.title: Not Stable, Damages Drives
customer_reviews.text: Anytime you disconnect one attached device, it unmounts all drives. This means if you plug in/un plug headphones, any usb drives connected through the hub unmount. Same for any USB device you connect/disconnect. When disconnecting one, it unmounts all drives. When this happens while one of those drives is being written to...that corrupts the drive. Update: The seller refunded my purchase price and sent a "new version." I appreciate their effort to solve my issue. That said, the "new version" is no different. And my MacBook Pro will not stay charged when running the power through this dock. It won't pass the full wattage to supply the computer. A+ for customer care, but C on the product.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin R.

customer_reviews.title: Did Not Work with My Setup
customer_reviews.text: I cannot figure out why my Manjaro Linux with KDE desktop could not recognize a second monitor connected to an HDMI port on this adapter and a cheaper adapter works fine. Others reported using this adapter with no problems. Since all the research I did didn't help, if I were to do it over I would order the cheapest possible adapter and work my way up until I found one that worked. Not an elegant strategy, but I don't have any better advice.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent DiCarlo

customer_reviews.title: Works as hub and pass-through power but cord short
customer_reviews.text: This works as advertised, and I was pleasantly surprised that the pass-through power (from a higher powered unit I have for my cell phone) suffices for a Surface 7 pro.....so, I don't have to tote around both cell and computer chargers. Issue is a short cord....can't even lay hub flat when using Surface as the 1 usb c port on that device is about 6 inches off the desk on which the Surface rests.....had to buy high capacity USB C extension.
customer_reviews.author: osguthjd

customer_reviews.title: I filled every port at once and everything worked
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to allow me to use my collection of USB devices on my new laptop which is all USB-C. I immediately tried my mouse, keyboard, and external backup drive. That was flawless. Then I read the warning sticker and proceeded to test each one. They are not kidding about this thing getting warm when fully loaded or connected up to the laptop charger. Fully loaded all the functions worked simultaneously without any issues. Additionally this device replaced two other single function dongles which was amazing.
customer_reviews.author: Troy B.

customer_reviews.title: Good value and excellent quality
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleasantly surprised at the quality of this hub for the price paid. It's more conpat than I expected which is fantastic for my tight workspace. I haven't attempted to charge a device off it, primarily using for USB as my laptop doesn't have them. However I have actually found the Ethernet port very useful as well recently. Overall good value and quality product. A similar unit from a large electronic retailer near me was around $30 more with fewer ports.
customer_reviews.author: FriendlyShopper

customer_reviews.title: Works Well Thus Far
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this for several weeks in lieu of a dock with my laptop (Lenovo X1 Carbon Yoga, 3rd Generation) and it seems to work well. It runs a little warm, but hasn't had any problems thus far. When I get in my office, I simply plug the USB-C connecter into the laptop and the hub automatically connects the display, keyboard, mouse, and seems to work well with my standard sized SD card from my camera. I may buy a second for travel.
customer_reviews.author: Eric The Red

customer_reviews.title: VAVA USB-C Hub Really Opens up my MacPro!
customer_reviews.text: MacPros have a limited number of USB-C ports. Coming from the Windows world I am used to having the flexibility to attach various devices. I looked for a hub that could combine everything I normally need into one port. This fits the bill. Since it has a Power Distribution port, I can use a single port to attach my power brick, along with Ethernet, headphone jack (don't ask...), SD readers, an HDMI cable and 3 USB inputs. I now have available USB-C ports to attach a backup drive, my iPhone and one port to spare....and the price is reasonable. Nice job!
customer_reviews.author: M. Salsburg

customer_reviews.title: Neccesity!
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolute necessity if you own a newer MAC. They removed all USB ports so you need an adapter and after much searching and a little trial and error, I decided on this one. I'm very happy with my purchase and it's been a lifesaver! I can plug in all my devices and never have to worry about not having enough ports. It's way cheaper than the Apple version for sure! I love that it's not a rigid plugin on the side on my MAC too. I prefer this plugin type of adapter. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie Dotts

customer_reviews.title: UPDATED... excellent
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to connect one HDMI, two usb 2.0, and power through the USB type C to my 2017 Dell XPS 13.... but the power isn't working. UPDATE: The product is working as intended, I just needed more power to run through the hub. So from a product standpoint 5 stars. On another note, customer service quick and effective. In addition, they sent another unit to ensure I was satisfied. Efforts like this make me a lifetime customer. High product recommendation. High company recommendation.
customer_reviews.author: Barclay

customer_reviews.title: Good after faulty unit on the first go
customer_reviews.text: *****UPDATE***** I am updating my review since the seller has been really responsive and replaced my unit since mine came defective. They replaced it and also make sure the second one was good to go. Recommended. Be aware that the product is nice when it works. After a month it stopped working and the ethernet port came lose. Can't get replacement because it has passed the 30 day return period.
customer_reviews.author: Grouchy

customer_reviews.title: Compact and packed with ports but some trade-offs
customer_reviews.text: I like the small form factor and number of ports loaded into the device that makes it easy to use on the go. That being said, I regularly get errors from my computers that it is having charging issues. I've read elsewhere that the device if very power hungry so it likely doesn't pass enough power through to satisfy the computer. The connection cord is also a bit short which can lead to some awkward cable placements especially if you are trying to use this on something like the Microsoft Surface where the USB-C port is elevated. For those curious if this will work with the Nintendo Switch, I did not have any luck getting it to work.
customer_reviews.author: N. Fortman

customer_reviews.title: Solid USB-C Port Adapter
customer_reviews.text: This was a really great gift for a friend who had been complaining about his new Macs dongles. It supports almost any type of cord you need and is easy to travel with. I would say there are probably things I'll like about it after I use it even more because I'm already impressed. It came in sturdy packaging and well insulated. I found this out the wrong way how important that is.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: This is the multiport you want.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful product. The ethernet port has a cover that flips down when you plug in the cord. Three usb ports, hdmi, everything you need in a nice what appears to be metal container. Amazingly small. I'll be buying more of these in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Z. Scott

customer_reviews.title: Lots of Options and Beautifully Made
customer_reviews.text: So I needed a device to replace my missing SD Card reader. I saw good reviews on the Vava and I noticed it also had an ethernet plug-in, HDMI, three USB ports and one USB-C port. Oh yeah and an aux cord port for audio. I had just purchased a MacBook Pro 13" smoky grey. The icing on the cake for me is that the Vava matches the finish of my new laptop. So it works great and it looks great. I'm always worried when I buy tech online. This one did not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: A. S. Moore

customer_reviews.title: Working great for my MacBook
customer_reviews.text: Only had the product a few days, but it's worked well for connecting my iPhone/iPad and other USB-A devices to the USB-C ports on my MacBook Pro 2019. The device warms ever so slightly, but I haven't tested with more than 2-3 ports being used simultaneously. The cable is flexible, but feels strong compared to others of similar thickness. The whole thing just feels pretty sturdy, have no concerns plugging/unplugging and moving around and rearranging. The only potential point of weakness in the future is the hinged ethernet, but I'm not very concerned: it's a snug fit, the hinge isn't loosely socketed at all. So far, been great!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel M

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful value and certainly works for 2018 MacBook Pro
customer_reviews.text: There are too many of these port multipliers out there that can't fulfill the promise of the advertising. I've got my Logitech Mouse controller, my Apple power supply, Ethernet, and wired keyboard all plugged into this hub. The hub is passing my Google Fiber internet at approx 900Mbps either up or down, and everything else is working fine. The device runs a bit warm, but it's often on for 14-15 hours a day. Easy to recommend.
customer_reviews.author: - Tech been good to me -

customer_reviews.title: computer won’t boot up with it plugged in
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine as a dock, but you have to unplug it before you reboot your computer or else your computer won’t start up - it gets stuck during boot up, which can be scary if you have an external HD plugged in that doesn’t mount properly. (MacBook Pro 2019) I returned it and bought a different one. Had to give them 4 stars because they warned me in the description it would happen, so it’s a known issue, but I didn’t think it would be a big deal. Turns out unplugging it every time you reboot was a hassle for me.
customer_reviews.author: screen name here

customer_reviews.title: Company sent the replacement! Excellent customer service!
customer_reviews.text: everything works fine except card reader, worked only for a few weeks and don't recognize cards anymore P.S. After the review, customer service has sent me a free replacement with the newer updated model and a free micro SD card. Everything works great so far. Excellent customer service!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handy hub
customer_reviews.text: This hub had been working well for me most days and had three right number and type of pets for my set up. I power my computer through this hub, so I've found it can get quite hot. A few times this has caused USB devices plugged into it to temporarily fail, but this has happened only on days when the indoor temperature is around 80F and the hub had been in use all day. To avoid this I unplug the power source from the hub every night so that it can cool down completely overnight. Overheating in the conditions I've exposed it to seems reasonable though I of course wish it didn't happen.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I am Macbook pro user, so I needed a good USB-C hub. This one fits the bill 10_000 percent. I love that it has built in power supply and Ethernet ports! So smart. The construction of the hub feels really solid too, not just some flimsy plastic. I do wish that the actual usb-c connector was bit more flexible, but that will improve over time, hopefully.
customer_reviews.author: plc86

customer_reviews.title: Great for any Macbook owner
customer_reviews.text: Very sleek and simple USB Hub. Works as expected. This is perfect for any mac user who needs to hook up to several inputs and doesn't want to plug all in one by one. Just leave everything connected at your workspace and you can easily connect your Macbook with the essentials. I got this hub because my previous one didn't have a power input. Just adds one less thing to plug in. The downside with this hub is there is only one hdmi and no usb c so connecting another monitor gets a litte tricky...
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: It’s stopped working after couple times- don’t waste your money
customer_reviews.author: Stan , Camelia

customer_reviews.title: Compact but sometimes spotty
customer_reviews.text: It's nice and small. Compatible with my 2020 macbook pro. I appreciated the many different ports. As a warning, I do have trouble with the port having spots of not working. Sometimes I plug it into the port on my computer, the blue indicator light turns on, but then nothing registers. Eventually, it randomly works again. I was contacted by the manufacturer to help resolve this issue.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: It works as advertised. It feels solid and well crafted, and took no drivers to use on my Windows 10 x64 laptop. I have not yet tried connecting anything to the USB C port or the card readers, though, but the USB, network, and HDMI ports work as they should.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn J Mentel

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I use this Hub to connect my MacBook Pro (Late 2016) to several other external hardware, including my Asus monitor via HDMI (not 4K), a Samsung SSD, and my Edifier speakers. Instead of plugging in three different things into my computer every morning, I now only connect them all via this Hub which has been great. I have not used this Hub's ethernet connection so I cannot speak to that but overall I am happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: M.F.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my MacBook Pro (Late 2016)! Love Power Delivery!
customer_reviews.text: Great product, highly recommended! I wish I would have gotten this when I first bought my mac instead of Apple's USB dongles. This device eliminates all the extra cords, provides more space for other port connections, and best of all provides power delivery which makes sure my large electronics connected to my computer still receive power without tanking my laptop battery! Love
customer_reviews.author: Keith Gray

customer_reviews.title: Has been works as advertised - 99% of the time
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this VAVA USB C Hub for my iPad Pro 12.9, 2020 model. I can hook up usb C power, my midi controller keyoard (irig 37mini) and wired headphones.. it works very well in that capacity for me. I only noticed some issues when I tried using my external WD My Passport drives on the hub. The problem is, iPad OS cannot properly eject these drives from the OS. When I unplug them and plug back in I get a flashing light. I then have to unplug everything and reboot my iPad Pro. Once that happens I'm able to plug in the external drive and it gets mounted properly. C'mon iPad OS!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian S.

customer_reviews.title: Good, but loses connection some times [edit]
customer_reviews.text: Good overall build quality, some times when all ports are being used, the usb mouse get's laggy and intermintently freezes. Then i have to unplug the whole thing, remove power, hdmi, and all usb's. This is quite anoying as i use it as a mini docking device, it is very sensitive to moving too, if i use it hanging on my lap it loses video connection very easyly. [EDIT] I bought another usb-c hub from another brand and turns out that the problem i've described is not on the hub, but on the notebook (Lenovo Yoga 730). Found another users with similar problems.
customer_reviews.author: Gustavo

customer_reviews.title: Broke after 5 months
customer_reviews.text: The product is great. Lots of USB ports, features, very sleek design. Biggest problem: Did not last 5 months of very mild usage. Simply stopped working one day. Edit/Update: Customer support came back with a replacement which seems to be working just fine so far for past few weeks. Edit: Replacement faulty after 2 months. Customer support wont stop spamming. Edit: Okay they sent me another replacement. This is my third one, lets see how this one goes.
customer_reviews.author: Srikanth Raju

customer_reviews.title: works, but computer gives a warning.
customer_reviews.text: So it works, but my HP spectre x360 comes up with a warning that I should use an original adapter. I am concerned it is not passing through the full power being supplied. Aside from that, it was immediately recognized, and worked with my HDMI monitor, wireless keyboard, headset, ethernet wire, etc. Not sure if i got a bum unit, if all the power is not going through, or if HP just puts something out there to detect and discourage non-HP products.
customer_reviews.author: Gregfman

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size For Travel!
customer_reviews.text: I finally used my VAVA USB-C Hub today on my new computer to do a data transfer from an external hard-drive. I transferred about 160GB of data and it took about one hour and 10 mins, not too shabby. The USB-C hub came in perfect condition. So far it works perfectly. I have no problems with it. There is also an 18 month warranty and lifetime customer service on this product which is great!
customer_reviews.author: JNW

customer_reviews.title: Ethernet froze/stuttered with camera
customer_reviews.text: There was a lot I liked about this device, but ultimately it failed in its most basic task. As others have pointed out, using the ethernet was hit or miss. It seemed to work unless I used an external camera for video conferences. It would then freeze up or stutter, usually after 10-15 minutes. Switching back to WIFI solved the problem. I need the higher speed of ethernet for conferencing and internet-based recording, so back it goes...
customer_reviews.author: Tom Jones

customer_reviews.title: ethernet stopped working, whenever HDMI port used.
customer_reviews.text: Brand new Hub's ethernet stopped working, on first day used, and I lost internet connection multiple times. Someone here posted the same problem, so I tried their recommendation, and if you disable the surface pro 7 WIFI, the ethernet does work fine. I found out the internet problem was the HDMI ! Whenever I connect the hub with the hdmi to a tv or even a monitor, I lose internet connection. I will update this posting if I am successful soon. NIce solid hub, nice connectors, all good, just ethernet issues, when using the hdmi..
customer_reviews.author: AL 55+

customer_reviews.title: No complaints, does its job well
customer_reviews.text: I've had the hub for about 3 months now and have had zero complaints. Most of the time I have two things plugged into the ports--a USB mouse and an ethernet cable, both of which have worked flawlessly. I have also added an HDMI cable at times, which is when I have noticed the hub getting warm (which makes sense with having 3 different things plugged into it). It never gets hot to the touch nor does anything ever glitch while I'm working. Glad I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: w

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, solid, an upgrade over Satechi
customer_reviews.text: I had the Satechi version of this and had endless problems with connectivity, specifically with the HDMI port. Would disconnect on its own, require manual replugging to get it working again, sometimes several times. So far I have not had the same issues with the VAVA version and the plug also sits more securely in my MacBook Pro's USB-C port. The Satechi version kinda of dangled out of the port and could slip out if touched slightly. I suggest this upgrade!
customer_reviews.author: anon

customer_reviews.title: You need one of these.
customer_reviews.text: This was recommended on Wirecutter, which I rely on heavily. In this day and age, computers have very few slots, so you need one of these which have several options. It is every light and I carry it in my briefcase with a disc forever in the expansion slot, doubling my laptop's memory.
customer_reviews.author: Duke Marquis

customer_reviews.title: Great for my needs!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little portable device with lots of connectivity, including an ethernet connection. For those of us who still like to manually back up but with new devices, its great! It gets a little hot with continued use, but I don't usually use it for long periods of time. Back ups are probably the longest, but other connectors I don't use for as long. So far its been reliable and I like that it offers ports that I don't use but might!
customer_reviews.author: Beatles Lover

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a while but now had intermittent issues  - drops video and network connections randomly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this adapter 2 years ago and for the first year the adapter worked but for the past few months I have noticed that the adapter drops video and network connections seemingly at random - I could be on a video call and have screen share on and I suddenly lose video connection and my ethernet also drops out - I have a 2nd unit which seems to work so I think I got a bad unit which has now stopped working. When it works it works well but I am beginning to question the reliability and quality of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Milind Khare

customer_reviews.title: best usb-c hub for iPD
customer_reviews.text: this supports hdcp 2.2 1.4 all that stuff. Netflix and Hulu works flawlessly and not only that, it seems to take less power consumption because while other usb-c hubs failed to charge my ipad on low 18w adapter but this one actually passes power thru so it's perfect. Edit: also wanted to add that the Ethernet port on this works with iPad too! I was surprised to find out it works after the iPadOS 13.4 update with mouse support. It’s a perfect ipad dock!
customer_reviews.author: TK YAGE

customer_reviews.title: A must for Mac owners
customer_reviews.text: Recently made the transfer from PC to a MacBook Pro. Adjusting to all USB-C has been tough. Without this product, I wouldn't be able to use my wireless mouse or charge any other devices :( This hub also makes it super easy to connect to a monitor and charge my laptop! Overall, I highly recommend this. The build feels high quality and not cheaply made at all. I think there was a $10 off coupon when I bought this, so that was nice.
customer_reviews.author: Isabel

customer_reviews.title: Good value - works great
customer_reviews.text: A friend said they were not able to run their camera through a hub they bought. I was able to run 2 cameras through this hub. I was debating whether to buy a much more expensive sub to be sure the cameras at different distances work for my Zoom classes. No need. This works great.
customer_reviews.author: BethGB

customer_reviews.title: A necessity!
customer_reviews.text: With the newer laptop computers (MacBooks), there are no ports for HDMI and traditional USB, etc. As I do presentations using projectors or large TVs, I need the HDMI connection. Also, I use a recording device that connects to a computer for transcribing via USB. This hub does the job well and is streamlined and easy to take with me.
customer_reviews.author: GourmetRose

customer_reviews.title: Solid hub with everything necessary
customer_reviews.text: The build quality feels pretty great. My only quibble is the finicky nature of the ethernet port. For insertion, it has to be titled slightly downward. One other minor issue: the hub doesn't seem to support USB receiver mouses without some lag. Otherwise I would definitely buy again. Glad to know Anker isn't the only brand making good portable USB-C hubs!
customer_reviews.author: jamiroquai

customer_reviews.title: Gets warm fast if more than 2 ports connected
customer_reviews.text: I tried charging my MacBook via the HUB against charging it directly. The HUB takes about 40% more time to charge as compared to charging it directly. All the ports works fine but the only issue I have is once you have more than 2 ports connected, the hub does get really warm quickly which made me wonder how much power is dissipated and wasting electricity. Of course, there is power dissipations within the wires if you choose to use those produced by Apple so I can't really make a correct interpretation on the efficiency of this product. The colour scheme also fits the moon grey of MacBook perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Ultrabooks or Macbooks
customer_reviews.text: My wife wanted to use the TV in her office as a second screen. But her laptop didn’t have an HDMI port! As it becomes more and more common on laptops to only have a couple USB-C ports this product fit every need I had including the ability to have an Ethernet port for her laptop! Great quality build it feels solid in the hand. Feels solid when connecting to the laptop. Provides all the ports that I could ask for and does it all without being big and bulky like some of the other adaptors out there.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Metteer

customer_reviews.title: Extends the USB-C port and charges phone at the same time.
customer_reviews.text: Used as a hub and power injector for my phone. Used in concert with a large backup battery(30k mah), I can have an external SSD, keyboard, Mouse, and HDMI monitor plugged into my phone and work all day long without any trouble. I use an LG V35 phone.
customer_reviews.author: oogabooga

customer_reviews.title: Decent
customer_reviews.text: This device is just fair. After two weeks of use, one of the USB ports just stopped working. I attempted to go through the warranty replacement process through the support email, and with each response was to do more testing. I don't mind trying few trouble shooting steps, but when it takes more than two days to get responses, and each response has at least three different tests to try, it becomes burdensome.
customer_reviews.author: M. Abugow

customer_reviews.title: works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: works well. I use it mainly for transferring photos and it can get hot when working long hours. I really think pass through power is a must, especially when working long hours or transferring large caches of photos! I am getting a cooling pad and expect that to help.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Nichols

customer_reviews.title: An Adaptor Nice to Have
customer_reviews.text: I bought this again for my friend. This is a nice product which have most of the function you need for a notebook adaptor. The material was nice, made from aluminum for the shell. You will have a very good feel when using it. Compare with the last version, the heating problem is still here. But from my experience, it doesn't affect your usage. Maybe they just use it as the cooling mechanism? Just one more thing I suggest for the improvement. I suggest this product should include a small bag as I need to carry this in my backpack a lot of the time. I am kind of afraid it will be damaged without one.
customer_reviews.author: T.J.K

customer_reviews.title: Great USB C Dongle for your Mac Laptop
customer_reviews.text: I have two! One I keep near my printers/scanners when I need a direct connection to them, and the other upstairs near my charger and my backup drives. I also bought a device that plugged in to the two USB C ports on the side of the laptop, but the laptop case gets in the way of the connection. This one works great
customer_reviews.author: jeff parnes

customer_reviews.title: Sleek and multi functional USB-C adapter
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little all in one USB-C adapter that gives you USB3 ports, Gigabit Ethernet connector, HDMI for external monitor, Audio port, SD and TF card reader, high power charging capability for your devices, really amazing combo for any USB-C enabled laptop. It worked pretty seamlessly with my Mac, just plug and play and everything works. Data transfers are fast, external monitor works with no issues, quite happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: FlyingAlex

customer_reviews.title: Great unit, going to be very useful
customer_reviews.text: Single biggest problem is that my laptop does not have a USB type C port. Had to order a separate female, USB type C to USB type A Male converter. It will arrive in a couple of days, but the unit fits my Samsung 8 just fine. Just not very useful there.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: USB Hub is OK.  Ethernet Port is DOA.
customer_reviews.text: As with several others who have reviewed this product, it seems to work fine as a USB hub, as long as you weren't planning to use the Ethernet port. I'm not sure how my Mac is supposed to react, but with the USB hub attached and the ethernet cable plugged in, the link lights come on, but the Mac shows no awareness of the existence of an Ethernet port/connection. It's not worth the hassle of returning it since my wireless network is OK, but had I known the Ethernet port wouldn't work I would have selected a different hub.
customer_reviews.author: MCSaavedra

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs up!
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive ($45), small, well made and works without a hitch. I'm using the Vava USB C hub with a 2019 MacBook Pro without a Touch Bar and it works great in my home office. I've connected it to my home monitor via USB and I have a webcam and microphone connected via USB. The Ethernet adaptor is nice to have as well. The adaptor does get warm but not overly hot. Recommended+
customer_reviews.author: Chris Pepin

customer_reviews.title: Ethernet port not working
customer_reviews.text: **Updated** Customer service contacted me giving me options to what would be best for me, per my issue. Very nice and attentive, surely will try other products in the future. My decision to buy this hub relied on the ethernet port. As of arrival, the port is not working. I made sure everything else is ok, testing the connection with my Mac through a USB3.0 Anker hub with an ethernet port. All of the other ports seem to be working including the PD to my Mac Pro.
customer_reviews.author: Pao

customer_reviews.title: 100% Happy
customer_reviews.text: This hub transfers data at the same speed as a device plugged directly into my Macbook Pro Late 2019 does. I've had issues with other hubs not providing top transfer speeds for both SD/MicroSD cards and USB SSD drives. The built quality feels solid. The cord length and quilty is also excellent. I'm pleased with the value. I would trust this brand in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Neil

customer_reviews.title: I've had it a while and learned to love it!
customer_reviews.text: I've had my USB-C dock for a while now and I still use it everyday! At first I had some hiccups with using external displays but was quickly resolved when I contacted Customer Support and I can tell you from my experience that they were great! Attentive and prompt response solved my issue right away and been happy since. Also a little advice, it really does help using this with a DC-in for some devices are power hungry and needs hot power delivered to function properly, NOT required but definitely helps!
customer_reviews.author: Ben V.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for MacBook with hardshell cases
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! As you can see, I’ve got firstly, the Hyper-Drive adapter, however does not fits on my Mac because the hardshell from INCASE. Every time I wanted to use the Hyper Adapter, I had to remove the bottom hardshell. It’s a pain! The VAVA adapter solved my problem, and now, besides the fact I can use my Mac “wearing” the complete hardshell, now I have an ethernet port that hyperdrive has not. For last, but not at least, the VAVA adapter is way cheaper than the hyper. The only thing I miss and would like, is a leather case for adapter like the first one I bought. Five stars!
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Barreto Machado Junior

customer_reviews.title: Broke after a couple monthes.
customer_reviews.text: For the first couple months, it worked pretty well, but then it started to get a little finicky, then stopped working altogether. When I plug in my phone charger and my computer into it it won't work, and the little blue light won't show up anymore. Edit: they send me a refund and a replacement. The replacement works well. Good customer service.
customer_reviews.author: JB Wang

customer_reviews.title: It has all the ports that I need for my dell new generation laptop
customer_reviews.text: I bought a new Dell laptop that doesn't have many ports and I need to use an ethernity cable and SD card reader connectivity which the new generation laptops don'thave them so this small USB C hub was perfect solution, it has all what you need so you don't need to connect anything to your laptop, all the ports in your laptop stays new. I suggest this product for all who has new generation laptops: Dell, Lenovo, hp, MacBook, Microsoft surface, chrome book and others.
customer_reviews.author: Mustapha

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: After reading stellar reviews and expert recommendations I got this to use with MacBook and it has not delivered. It worked for a couple of months and then became very inconsistent. Possibly a manufacturing defect, but there is no way to just get these not too cheap accessories repaired at your neighborhood store. Super frustrating! And while it is great for travel, reckon the warranty doesn't travel. Probably still a great product, I just got a bad piece.
customer_reviews.author: Saranya

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after couple of weeks
customer_reviews.text: I wrote to the manufacturer. They promised to send me a replacement. I was foolish to believe them. Now after the return window, I have a product that doesn't work, promise of replacement not kept and no way to return this product. Amazon should stop encouraging such vendors!
customer_reviews.author: PrimeLover

product_meta.title: VAVA USB C Hub, 9-in-1 USB C Adapter with Ethernet Port, PD Power Delivery, 4K USB C to HDMI, USB 3.0 Ports, Mic/Audio Port, SD/TF Cards Reader for MacBook/Pro/Air and Type C Windows Laptops
product_meta.description:
VAVA - Smart Made Simple 
2 x USB 3.0
1 x USB 2.0
1 x Ethernet port
1 x 4K HDMI Port
1 x SD Card Reader 
1 x TF Card Reader 
1 x 3.5mm Audio Por
1 x Type C PD Charging Port

Compatible Devices: 
Apple Macbook Air (2018), Apple MacBook/ Pro (2016 / 2017/2018), Apple iMac / iMac Pro (21.5 in & 27 in). 
Google ChromeBook Pixel, Dell, HP, Dell, Asus, HP, Lenovo and more laptops based on USB Type-C Protocol (USB 3.1 & PD 3.0 & DP 1.2). 
Note: VAVA USB C hubs do not support iPad Pro 2018. 

PD Power Delivery 
Power is shared between all dock-connected USB-C devices and adjusted based on needs. 
The hub delivers about 49W for charging a connected laptop and 11W for powering the hub when connected to a 60W power input. 
Delivers about 29W for charging the connected laptop and 11W for powering the hub when connected to a 40W power input. 

4K Video Adapter 
Simply connect with the HDMI port and you can enjoy Ultra HD (4K) at 30Hz or Full HD (1080p) at 60Hz with high definition audio instantly. 
4K capable display and HDMI 2.0 cable are required to achieve 3840 x 2160 resolution. 

Gigabit Ethernet Port
A stable, reliable web access of up to 1Gbps is granted with the supplied Gigabit Ethernet port. 
1Gbps LAN port of the router and CAT5e cable and high speed Ethernet driver are required to get 1Gbps. 

Warranty: 
Industry-leading 30 days worry free return and 18-month warranty & extra 12-month warranty at VAVA’s website. 
Easy-to-reach support: warranty card/ website support/Amazon email. 

Please note：
The USB ports are intended for data transfer. Supports multiple flash drives, but can only support one external hard drive at a time due to the power requirements. 
Under full using, the maximum working temperature of this USB C hub may up to 55°C, which may feel hot to the touch, no worry (The chips can work at 161.6°F /75°C).

Never loose your internet connection: With the included Ethernet port a stable, reliable web access of up to 1 Gaps is granted
Fast PD recharging: Fuel your MacBook Pro or other Type-C port Devices with a power delivery while connecting multiple peripherals for a worry-free data transfer
Connect 3 devices: thanks to the triple USB ports you can connect a keyboard, mouse, thumb drive to a MacBook Pro, or a Windows Type-C laptop
Compatibility: No driver needed and support all type C devices but some exceptions may apply.
